title: Marcy Kaptur - Wikipedia
snippet: During the 1980s, she developed a good working relationship with Speaker Jim Wright, who later appointed her as vice chair of a task force on trade and to the Democratic Steering and Policy Committee. In her fourth term, she gained a position on the Budget Committee and afterwards secured a seat on the Appropriations Committee. In 1987, Kaptur introduced the World War II Memorial Act in the House.

title: Marcy Kaptur | Congress.gov | Library of Congress
snippet: Marcy Kaptur, the Representative from Ohio - in Congress from 1983 through Present

title: About Marcy | Congresswoman Marcy Kaptur
snippet: In 1981, while pursuing a doctorate in urban planning and development finance at MIT, she was recruited by the Lucas County Democratic Party to run for Congress against a first-term Republican. Although she was outspent by a 3-to-1 margin, Kaptur parlayed a strong economic message during the 1982 recession to stage a nationally-recognized upset.

title: Marcy Kaptur - Ballotpedia
snippet: Larson defeated Steven Kraus and Joel Lieske in the Republican primary on March 15, 2016.[18] See also: Ohio's 9th Congressional District elections, 2014 Â· Kaptur ran for re-election to the U.S. House in 2014.

title: Committee Assignments | Congresswoman Marcy Kaptur
snippet: Rep. Kaptur has previously served on the Committees on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs, Veterans Affairs, Agriculture, Oversight and Government Reform, and the Select Committee on Economic Disparity and Fairness in Growth.
